alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern Union; Hudson; Western Union (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 29 at 5:03PM EDT until September 30 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...There continues to be potential for scattered to numerous instances of flash flooding. Locally considerable and life threatening flash flooding remains possible. * WHERE...Portions of southern Connecticut, including the following areas, Northern Fairfield, Northern New Haven, Southern Fairfield and Southern New Haven. Portions of northeast New Jersey, including the following areas, Eastern Bergen, Eastern Essex, Eastern Passaic, Eastern Union, Hudson, Western Bergen, Western Essex, Western Passaic and Western Union. Portions of southeast New York, including the following areas, Bronx, Kings (Brooklyn), New York (Manhattan), Northeast Suffolk, Northern Nassau, Northern Queens, Northern Westchester, Northwest Suffolk, Orange, Putnam, Richmond (Staten Island), Rockland, Southeast Suffolk, Southern Nassau, Southern Queens, Southern Westchester and Southwest Suffolk. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...There continues to be potential for scattered to numerous instances of flash flooding, especially in urban and poor drainage areas. Locally considerable and life threatening flash flooding remains possible where axis of heaviest rain develops and sits for several hours. If this heavier rainfall axis develops over the flashy river and stream basins of northeastern NJ, Lower Hudson Valley, and southwestern CT, moderate flood stages could be exceeded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Additional rainfall of 1 to 3 inches is forecast with locally higher amounts possible. There are already areas which have experienced flooding and the additional rain will exacerbate the flooding in these areas. In addition, heavy rain coinciding with high tide for coastal sections will further exacerbate flooding there. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should additional Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern Union; Hudson; Western Union
